page.title: 02Landscape around Pencombe
page.content: Pencombe is situated in a basin surrounded by high ridges to the north and west from which there are panoramic views to all points of the compass. Although most of the area is high it is all cultivated with valleys draining to the SW & NE. The majority of the fields are hedged with trees and are approximately ten to twenty acres giving an impression of rich farmland. The farmhouses are varied, some black and white, others stone or red brick. The view of the village from the road between Hegdon and Gasbage gives an impression of Pencombe nestling in a fertile valley surrounded by fields hedged with mature trees. The new red brick dwellings contrast sharply with the mellowed stone church and farm, and whitewashed cottages.
